items.title: US indicts five individuals in crackdown on North Korea’s illicit IT workforce
items.author: Carly Page
items.summary:
- U.S. authorities indicted five individuals for involvement in a North Korean IT worker scheme that allowed remote employment with U.S. companies.
- Indicted individuals include two North Koreans, a Mexican national, and two U.S. nationals, with several arrests made.
- The scheme operated from April 2018 to August 2024, affecting at least 64 American organizations and generating $866,255 in revenue, primarily laundered through a Chinese bank account.

items.title: Tata acquires 60% stake in Apple-partner Pegatron’s India unit
items.author: Manish Singh
items.summary:
- Tata Electronics acquired a 60% controlling stake in Pegatron’s unit in India.
- This acquisition occurs less than a year after Tata acquired Wistron’s local business.
- Pegatron, an important Apple assembly partner, operates a production plant near Chennai, Tamil Nadu.
- Financial details of the deal were not disclosed, but Tata aims to expand its manufacturing footprint in India.
- Randhir Thakur, CEO of Tata Electronics, emphasized a focus on AI and technology-led manufacturing expansion.
- Tata began iPhone assembly in India in the previous year and is emerging as a key partner for Apple in Asia.

items.title: Madrona just announced its biggest fund ever, closing on $770M as other venture funds grow smaller
items.author: Marina Temkin
items.summary:
- Seattle-based Madrona Capital has raised $770 million, its largest fundraise to date.
- The new capital exceeds the $690 million closed across two funds in 2022, showcasing strong investor interest.
- Madrona's managing director, Matt McIlwain, highlighted successful portfolio exits including Lexion and Octo AI.
- The firm plans to invest in AI applications across various sectors and support early-stage startups as well as Series B and C companies.
- Madrona has evolved from a group of super angels to a multi-stage investor, with a notable geographic expansion into Silicon Valley in 2022.

items.title: Reliance plans world’s biggest AI data centre in India, report says
items.summary:
- Mukesh Ambani’s Reliance is set to build the world's largest data center in Jamnagar, India, with a capacity of 3 gigawatts to meet rising AI demand.
- The new facility will surpass Microsoft's existing largest data center in Virginia, which has a capacity of 600 megawatts.
- Projected cost of the data center ranges from $20 billion to $30 billion.
- Reliance intends to power the facility mainly with renewable energy from a nearby green energy complex.
- Nvidia chips will be used in the data center, following a partnership between Nvidia and Reliance to enhance AI infrastructure in India.

items.title: Tesla’s redesigned Model Y is coming to North America in March for $60,000
items.author: Sean O'Kane
items.summary:
- Tesla announced the redesigned Model Y SUV will be available in the U.S., Canada, and Mexico in March, starting at nearly $60,000.
- This launch coincides with the rollout in China, marking a simultaneous global release.
- The new model features a starting price of $59,990 for the 'Launch Series', offering a 320-mile range and advanced driver-assistance technology.
- Notable design changes include a new front fascia and improved interior features like rear-passenger touchscreen and powered rear seats.
- Tesla aims to refresh its aging lineup after delivering fewer vehicles in 2024 due to market challenges.

items.title: Even some of the best AI can’t beat this new benchmark
items.summary:
- The nonprofit Center for AI Safety (CAIS) and Scale AI released a new benchmark called Humanity’s Last Exam for frontier AI systems.
- The benchmark contains thousands of crowdsourced questions covering mathematics, humanities, and natural sciences, in various formats including diagrams and images.
- A preliminary study revealed that no publicly available flagship AI system scored better than 10% on the new benchmark.
- CAIS and Scale AI plan to make the benchmark accessible to the research community for further evaluation of AI models.

items.title: JetBrains launches Junie, a new AI coding agent for its IDEs
items.author: Frederic Lardinois
items.summary:
- JetBrains launched a new AI coding agent named [Junie](https://www.jetbrains.com/junie/) for its IDEs.
- Junie is designed to handle routine development tasks and understand existing projects for feature extensions.
- It scored 53.6% on the SWEBench Verified benchmark of 500 developer tasks, which is considered promising, though lower than top competitors.
- The service is tightly integrated with JetBrains IDEs, maintains human control, and aims to improve code quality.
- Currently in an early access program, Junie is available only on Linux and Mac for IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate and PyCharm Professional, with WebStorm support coming soon.

items.title: Trump orders formation of working group to evaluate crypto stockpile
OpenAI says it may store deleted Operator data for up to 90 days
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- OpenAI may store chats and screenshots from its Operator AI tool for up to 90 days, even after deletion by users.
- Operator’s data retention period is 60 days longer than the 30 days for ChatGPT.
- The retention policy aims to prevent misuse and enhance fraud monitoring.
- Operator can perform tasks autonomously like booking travel and shopping, releasing in a paid research preview.
- Users are advised that screenshots may be accessed by authorized personnel for abuse investigations and legal matters.

items.title: Everyone wants MrBeast on their TikTok bid, but he hasn’t committed yet
items.author: Charles Rollet
items.summary:
- MrBeast (Jimmy Donaldson) is in discussions regarding multiple bids for TikTok’s U.S. operations.
- CEO Jesse Tinsley claims MrBeast is part of an all-cash bid he is leading, but MrBeast has not made any exclusive commitments.
- Frank McCourt leads a $20 billion bid and asserts MrBeast's involvement, but no official agreement has been made.
- MrBeast has earned $85 million in 2024 and his celebrity status appeals to multiple bidders looking to enhance their proposals.
- Other potential bidders include Perplexity and Oracle, but MrBeast has not publicly confirmed his decision yet.

items.title: Anthropic’s new Citations feature aims to reduce AI errors
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Anthropic introduced a new feature called Citations to enhance its AI models' accuracy by referencing source documents.
- Citations is available in Anthropic’s API and Google’s Vertex AI platform.
- The feature helps in document summarization, Q&A, and customer support by providing detailed references.
- Currently, Citations is limited to Claude 3.5 Sonnet and Claude 3.5 Haiku models, and may incur charges based on document length.

items.title: Fitbit fined $12M over Ionic smartwatch burns
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Fitbit has been fined $12.25 million over burn hazards related to its Ionic smartwatch.
- The issue first arose in 2018 and continued through 2020, leading to a recall in March 2022.
- A total of 115 reports of overheating batteries were made, with 78 individuals suffering burns, including two third-degree burns.
- Fitbit failed to report the hazard immediately to the CPSC, despite having evidence of potential risks.
- The settlement requires Fitbit to submit annual reports and maintain compliance protocols with the Consumer Product Safety Act.

items.title: Threads rolls out a post scheduler, ‘markup’ feature, and more
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Instagram Threads introduces a post scheduler and enhanced metrics in its Insights dashboard.
- Users can now track views, follower demographics, interactions, and more over a specified time period.
- A new 'markup' feature allows users to draw on reshared posts with creative tools like a highlighter or arrow, aiming to differentiate Threads from competitors.

items.title: Tom Brady’s Autograph merges with digital fitness company Future
items.author: Dominic-Madori Davis
items.summary:
- Autograph, co-founded by Tom Brady, is merging with digital fitness company Future.
- Brady will join Future's board and serve as co-chair post-merger.
- Autograph raised $200 million, pivoting from NFTs to a platform focused on fan engagement.
- Future connects users with personalized digital fitness coaching.
- The merger aims to combine celebrity connections with fitness expertise, facilitating training with top athletes.

items.title: Hidden Waymo feature let researcher customize robotaxi’s display
items.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
items.summary:
- A security researcher discovered a hidden feature in the Waymo app that allowed customization of the robotaxi display.
- Jane Manchun Wong demonstrated changes to the display, including adding her X handle and emojis.
- Waymo acknowledged the feature and subsequently restricted access to it for regular users.

items.title: Trump’s not happy with how EU regulators have treated US tech giants
items.summary:
- President Donald Trump criticized EU regulators for their treatment of U.S. tech companies like Google, Meta, and Apple.
- He described the EU's actions as a "form of taxation" during his speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos.
- Trump highlighted Apple's €13 billion tax bill case in Ireland, stating it was due to illegal tax breaks found by the EU’s Court of Justice.
- The Trump Administration is expected to have ongoing disputes with the EU throughout his second term.
- All three companies are under investigation for potential violations of the EU’s Digital Markets Act.

items.title: Bedrock Energy wants geothermal to make data centers cooler and offices more comfortable
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary:
- Bedrock Energy is utilizing geothermal energy for cooling and heating, drilling deeper than typical geothermal wells.
- The company aims for more space-efficient installations, achieving depths of 800 to 1,200 feet.
- Two installations completed last year in Texas and Utah; expects profitability on a project basis in the next year.
- Exploring geothermal cooling for data centers, facing challenges due to continual heat generation from servers.
- Geothermal cooling is more efficient than traditional methods, offering stable electricity usage for large consumers.

items.title: Epic brings third-party titles to its mobile game store
items.summary:
- Epic Games is adding third-party games to its mobile app store and covering associated iOS fees.
- A free games program will launch, rolling out new free games each month.
- The games will be available on Android worldwide and in the EU on iOS.
- Epic's mobile store launched in August with its own titles like Fortnite and Rocket League, and is now expanding to include outside developers' games.
- CEO Tim Sweeney states that Epic has invested over $1 billion in its digital storefront.

items.title: OpenAI and SoftBank are reportedly putting $19B each into Stargate
items.summary:
- OpenAI and SoftBank are set to commit $19 billion each to the Stargate project.  
- Stargate aims to create data centers for OpenAI across the U.S. with a total investment target of $500 billion.  
- Partners have initially pledged $100 billion, with ongoing development at a facility in Abilene, Texas.  
- Elon Musk questioned the project's financial backing, which Sam Altman called incorrect.

items.title: Android 16’s first beta version brings iOS-style live notifications
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- Google released the first public beta for Android 16 on Thursday, following two developer beta versions last year.
- New features include live updates on the lock screen, an Advanced Professional Video (APV) codec for high-quality video, and tools for responsive app design.
- The live updates feature allows developers to push real-time updates, similar to Apple’s Live Activities.
- APV codec offers lossless quality and supports high bitrates for 2K, 4K, and 8K footage, enhancing video recording and editing.
- Android 16 introduces new accessibility features such as mandatory field indicators in APIs.
- Google aims to expedite the Android update cycle, targeting a final release in Q2 2025.

items.title: Substack introduces a $20M funding guarantee to entice creators to migrate to its platform
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Substack launched its Creator Accelerator Fund, providing a $20 million funding guarantee for creators transitioning to its platform.
- The fund ensures creators retain all existing revenue during the move, addressing concerns about income stability.
- Unlike other platforms that charge fees, Substack takes a 10% cut of revenue and offers assistance with migration and business strategies.

items.title: X sees a jump in consumer spending on mobile, despite decline in daily active users
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- X's in-app revenue grew 76.3% year-over-year, reaching $13.4 million from January 1-20, 2025.
- Daily active users decreased by approximately 13% from January 2024 to January 2025.
- Competing apps Bluesky and Instagram Threads saw user growth of over 495% and 170%, respectively.
- The growth in consumer spending may be attributed to features like the xAI Grok chatbot, launched in late 2024.
- In the U.S., consumer spending on the X app also increased by 61.4% year-over-year, from $4.4 million to $7.1 million.

items.title: Canoo Craters and Trump Comes for EVs
items.summary:
- President Trump signed executive orders pausing EV funding from the Inflation Reduction Act and Bipartisan Infrastructure Law on his first day back in office.
- Canoo filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy and ceased all operations, with major implications for employees and stakeholders.
- Rivian finalized a $6.6 billion loan for a new factory in Georgia as a part of the DOE’s program, with construction set for 2026 and first vehicles expected in 2028.
- Other notable deals include funding for startups like Ati Motors, Lyteflo, and Moment Energy, highlighting ongoing investment in the EV sector.

items.title: OpenAI launches Operator, an AI agent that performs tasks autonomously
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary:
- OpenAI announced the launch of Operator, a general-purpose AI agent, during its first research preview.
- Operator can control a web browser to automate tasks like booking travel and making reservations, starting with U.S. users on ChatGPT’s $200 Pro plan.
- The AI agent is powered by a new model called the computer-using agent (CUA) and can interact with websites like a human, needing user confirmation for sensitive actions.

items.title: After pivoting from crypto to payroll, Rollfi gets acquired
items.author: Kirubha Perumalsamy
items.summary:
- Rollfi was co-founded in 2021 to help process digital payments during the crypto boom.
- Following the crypto crash, the company pivoted to embedded payroll services, partnering with financial firms.
- Rollfi has been acquired by Priority Tech Ventures for an undisclosed amount after raising $3.25 million.
- CEO Kirubha Perumalsamy indicated that the team will continue under Priority as an independent entity.

items.title: Roli releases a 49-key educational keyboard and generative AI play
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Roli announced its new educational product, the Roli Piano, at the NAAM audio show in Anaheim.
- The Piano features 49 MIDI keys and syncs with an instructional app on mobile devices.
- Priced at $599, it is more than double the cost of its predecessor, the Piano M, which is currently $249; a limited-time early bird price of $399 is also available.
- The launch includes the Piano AI Assistant, aimed at making learning to play easier and integrating music theory.
- Roli's shift towards educational products follows its bankruptcy filing in 2021, targeting expansive market potential.

items.title: Perplexity launches an assistant for Android
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Perplexity has launched an AI-powered assistant named Perplexity Assistant for Android, enhancing daily task management.
- The assistant can perform multi-app actions, access web data, and maintain context between tasks.
- Initially available for free in 15 languages; features may have limitations during rollout.
- Launched shortly after introducing an API service and acquiring a social media platform, demonstrating rapid growth and securing over $500 million in funding since its founding in 2022.
- Facing legal challenges from publishers regarding content usage, while attempting to expand monetization efforts and partnerships with news outlets.

items.title: Spacetech Voyager is aiming for a multi-billion valuation IPO
items.summary:
- Voyager Technologies has filed confidential paperwork for an IPO.
- The company has raised over $215 million from investors like Afterburner Capital and Balerion Space Ventures.
- Projected valuation for the IPO is between $2 billion and $3 billion, led by Morgan Stanley and Latham & Watkins.
- Founded in 2019, Voyager offers propulsion technologies and in-space infrastructure.
- Voyager has partnered with Palantir to integrate AI into its offerings.

items.title: A comprehensive list of 2024 and 2025 tech layoffs
items.summary:
- In 2024, over 150,000 jobs were cut across 542 tech companies.
- Major layoffs included companies like [Tesla](https://techcrunch.com/2024/04/15/tesla-layoffs-workers-sales-cybertruck-cuts/), [Amazon](https://techcrunch.com/2024/01/10/amazon-prime-video-and-mgm-studios-laid-off-hundreds-of-employees/), [Google](https://techcrunch.com/2024/01/10/google-cuts-hundreds-of-jobs-in-its-voice-assistance-hardware-teams-as-fitbit-founders-leave/), [TikTok](https://techcrunch.com/2024/01/23/tiktok-lays-off-60-employees/), [Snap](https://techcrunch.com/2024/02/05/snapchats-parent-lays-off-10-of-workforce-in-order-to-reduce-hierarchy-says-company/), and [Microsoft](https://techcrunch.com/2024/01/25/microsoft-lays-off-1900-employees-in-activision-blizzard-and-xbox-divisions/).
- The trend of layoffs is expected to continue into 2025, with plans to provide updated lists for both years.

items.title: Brave will allow you to tune search results with upvotes and downvotes
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- Brave Search introduces a new feature called Rerank, allowing users to upvote or downvote websites to refine search results.
- The Rerank feature will appear in the top right corner of the search results page and adjust results based on user preferences.
- Brave claims this feature eliminates opaque algorithms and provides transparency and control in the search experience.
- The new feature is powered by existing Goggles functionality, aimed at simplifying personalization in search queries.
- Brave currently handles over 38 million queries daily and more than 1.2 billion monthly.

items.title: Passbolt raises $8M for its open source password manager for teams
items.author: Kevin Muller, Remy Bertot, Cédric Alfonsi
items.summary:
- Passbolt raises $8 million in a Series A funding round led by Airbridge Equity Partners to enhance its open-source password manager for teams.
- Over 38,000 teams currently use Passbolt, with 2,000 paying users opting for additional features and services.
- Passbolt aims to offer a more collaborative and secure password management solution compared to existing tools like Bitwarden or KeePass, with features like role-based access controls and a self-hosted alternative.

items.title: Hackers found a way to remotely unlock, start, and track millions of Subarus
items.author: Sam Curry, Shubham Shah
items.summary:
- A year ago, two researchers discovered vulnerabilities in a Subaru web portal allowing hijacking of car controls and tracking of driver location data.
- Subaru has fixed the vulnerabilities after the researchers reported their findings.
- The vulnerabilities also pose a broader security issue, affecting multiple automakers including Acura, Honda, Hyundai, and Toyota.

items.title: Meta’s Yann LeCun predicts a ‘new AI architectures paradigm’ within 5 years and ‘decade of robotics’
items.author: Yann LeCun, Paul Sawers
items.summary:
- Yann LeCun predicts a new paradigm of AI architectures will emerge in the next 3-5 years, surpassing existing AI capabilities.
- He anticipates the coming decade could be the ‘decade of robotics’, combining AI advancements with robotics.
- Current generative AI and large language models (LLMs) may lose relevance, facing limitations like lack of understanding, memory, reasoning, and planning capabilities.
- LeCun emphasizes the need for ‘world models’ to enhance machines' understanding of the real world.
- Meta and OpenAI are working on robotic innovations showing potential for human-like intelligence.

items.title: ChatGPT suffered a major outage this morning, but OpenAI says it’s back up
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- ChatGPT experienced a significant outage on Thursday morning, impacting user access.
- OpenAI acknowledged the issue at 5:12 a.m. Pacific and identified the cause shortly after.
- By 7:09 a.m., OpenAI reported that a fix was implemented and they were monitoring the system's performance.
- The outage also affected OpenAI's API, but it has since been resolved.
- ChatGPT outages are rare but have occurred before, including a similar situation in December.

items.title: Coval evaluates AI voice and chat agents like self-driving cars
items.author: Brooke Hopkins
items.summary:
- Coval, founded by Brooke Hopkins, evaluates AI voice and chat agents similarly to self-driving cars.
- The startup runs thousands of simulations to test agent performance for various tasks, providing metrics and customization options for companies.
- In October 2024, Coval launched its product after strong demand and raised $3.3 million in a seed round led by MaC Venture Capital.

items.title: Method is helping fintech companies like SoFi build repayment functionality into their apps
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Method simplifies debt and repayment integration for fintech apps, aiming to overcome challenges such as screen-scraping APIs.
- Founded by Jose Bethancourt, Marco del Carmen, and Mit Shah, who previously faced connectivity issues while building GradJoy.
- Utilizes consumer credit access protections to aggregate debts and execute payments on behalf of users via simple API integration.
- Supports 30 million account connections for 4 million users and has facilitated over $500 million in repayments.
- Competes with vendors like Plaid and Spinwheel but aims to reduce friction by not requiring users to re-enter financial credentials.
- Recently raised $41.5 million in Series B funding to continue product development and expansion efforts.

items.title: Hugging Face claims its new AI models are the smallest of their kind
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Hugging Face has released two new AI models: SmolVLM-256M and SmolVLM-500M.
- The models are designed for constrained devices and ideal for processing large datasets cheaply.
- SmolVLM-256M has 256 million parameters and SmolVLM-500M has 500 million parameters.
- Both models can describe images, analyze text, and answer questions about scanned documents.
- Trained using 50 datasets and Docmatix captions, developed by Hugging Face's M4 team.
- They outperform the larger Idefics 80B model on certain benchmarks.
- Available for download under an Apache 2.0 license, implying unrestricted use.
- Small models may exhibit flaws in complex reasoning tasks as per a study by Google DeepMind and others.

items.title: Snap launches a new way to reward AR creators, rolls out student pricing for Spectacles
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Snap introduces a new "Challenge Tags" rewards program for AR developers to win cash prizes for their Lenses submissions.
- The first challenge, themed "humor", runs until January 31, with prizes totaling $4,250.
- Educational pricing for Spectacles includes a student discount, with subscriptions available at $49.50/month, down from $99.
- Eligible students, teachers, and staff across several countries can access the discounted Spectacles.

items.title: Fundraise Up claims its AI can boost nonprofit donations
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Fundraise Up aims to improve donation experiences for nonprofits by utilizing AI.
- The platform allows easy integration of donation features into nonprofit websites, supporting various payment methods.
- Features include personalized donation suggestions and upgrades to recurring donations.
- Fundraise Up charges a 4% transaction fee, providing a competitive pricing model without upfront costs.
- Over 3,000 nonprofits, including major organizations like the Canadian Red Cross, are using Fundraise Up.
- Fundraise Up raised $70 million in funding to expand its services and reach new markets.

items.title: Tive’s tools help companies track the status of their shipments in real time
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Tive, founded by Krenar Komoni, develops tools for real-time freight tracking, addressing visibility issues in global supply chains.
- Tive's tracking devices monitor location, temperature, humidity, light, and physical shocks.
- Tive has over 900 customers spanning pharmaceuticals, military, and government sectors, generating revenue through software fees, tracker sales, and monitoring services.
- The company aims to reach profitability by 2026 and has grown over 50% year-over-year despite the freight recession.
- Tive raised $40 million in a Series C round to expand its workforce and product development.

items.title: Y Combinator grad Spacium raises oversubscribed $6.3M for space re-fueling
items.author: Ashi Dissanayake, Reza Fetanat, Margaux Maccoll
items.summary:
- Spacium, a startup co-founded by Ashi Dissanayake and Reza Fetanat, raised $6.3 million in an oversubscribed seed round led by Initialized Capital.
- The company aims to address the lack of in-space refueling options, which currently leads to spacecraft becoming space debris after missions.
- Spacium plans a demo mission of its product capabilities later this year and already has a strong pipeline of customers.
- Dissanayake emphasizes their unique system for long-term fuel storage as a competitive advantage over other companies in the industry, such as Orbit Fab and Astroscale.

items.title: Quantum VC QDNL hits €25M first-close on new fund
items.author: Mike Butcher
items.summary:
- VC investment in quantum computing dropped by 50% from $2.2bn in 2022 to $1.2bn in 2023, shifting towards Generative AI.
- QDNL Participations has achieved a €25 million first close for a €60 million fund targeting early-stage quantum startups.
- QDNL aims to expand investments internationally and previously focused on the Dutch quantum ecosystem with a €15 million fund.

items.title: Everstone acquires bootstrapped Indian startup Wingify for $200M
items.author: Manish Singh
items.summary:
- Private equity firm Everstone acquires a majority stake in [Wingify](https://wingify.com/) for about $200 million.
- The deal marks a significant exit for founder Paras Chopra, who bootstrapped the startup since its inception in 2010.
- Wingify's annual revenue recently reached $50 million, serving over 4,000 clients in 90 countries.
- The acquisition enhances Everstone’s technology portfolio, focusing on profitable bootstrapped companies.

items.title: African fintech Moniepoint gets Visa backing, plans to work on contactless payments
items.author: Tage Kene-Okafor
items.summary:
- Visa invests over $10 million in Moniepoint to drive financial inclusion for SMEs in Africa.
- Moniepoint's Series C funding exceeds $120 million with $110 million previously announced.
- The fintech processes over 1 billion transactions monthly, with total payment volumes reaching $22 billion.
- Plans to introduce contactless payments and expand transaction capabilities in Nigeria and beyond.
- Visa aims to digitize payments for SMEs and increase its share in Nigeria’s card market.

items.title: OpenAI may preview its agent tool for users on the $200 per month Pro plan
items.author: Romain Dillet
items.summary:
- OpenAI’s agent tool, Operator, might soon be released as an early research preview for $200 Pro subscription users.  
- Code updates detected by a user indicate preparations for launch, with a new popup for Pro users prompting them to upgrade for access.  
- Operator could automate multi-step web tasks, suggesting a significant advancement in OpenAI’s tool capabilities based on previous Bloomberg and Information reports.

items.title: UK probes Apple and Google over ‘mobile ecosystem’ market power
items.author: Paul Sawers
items.summary:
- The U.K.’s Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) is launching investigations into Apple and Google's mobile ecosystems under the Digital Markets, Competition and Consumers Act.
- The CMA's investigations aim to determine if the companies have strategic market status and whether they dominate markets involving browsers, app stores, and operating systems.
- A previous inquiry found that Apple’s browser policies restrict competition, and the CMA plans to assess competition levels and terms imposed on app developers in the app stores.
- Stakeholders can submit comments for three weeks, with findings expected by October 22, 2025, which may lead to remedies to enhance competition.

items.title: WhatsApp wins reprieve in India over user data sharing
items.author: Manish Singh
items.summary:
- An Indian tribunal has suspended restrictions preventing WhatsApp from sharing user data with Meta.
- The ban was initially imposed by India's antitrust regulator, accusing WhatsApp of market dominance abuse.
- WhatsApp has over 700 million monthly users in India, its largest market.
- The tribunal ordered Meta to deposit approximately $12.35 million within two weeks; the case will be heard again on March 17.
- Meta's lawyers argue that upcoming digital privacy laws should govern these matters, rather than competition rules.

items.title: Neko, the body-scanning startup co-founded by Spotify’s Daniel Ek, snaps up $260M at a $1.8B valuation
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Neko Health has raised $260 million in Series B funding, valuing the company at $1.8 billion.
- The funding will help Neko expand into markets like the U.S. and develop its diagnostics further.
- The waitlist for Neko's services has increased from 40,000 to over 100,000 patients.
- The company has scanned 10,000 patients in its clinics located in Stockholm and London.
- Investors include Lightspeed Venture Partners and General Catalyst, among others.
- Neko aims to focus on preventative healthcare, emphasizing the importance of early detection and data-driven diagnostics.

items.title: Someone bought the domain ‘OGOpenAI’ and redirected it to a Chinese AI lab
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary:
- A software engineer purchased the domain **OGOpenAI.com** and redirected it to **DeepSeek**, a Chinese AI lab.
- The domain was acquired for less than the price of a Chipotle meal, with plans to resell it later.
- **DeepSeek** is gaining attention for releasing open AI models similar to OpenAI's early offerings, allowing developers to use them offline for free.
- The redirection was inspired by a post comparing **DeepSeek** with **OpenAI** in its Open days, aiming to highlight the contrast in their current models.
- The **U.S. government** has sought to limit China's AI advancements through chip export restrictions, reflecting on the competitive landscape of AI technology.

items.title: Google buys part of HTC’s XR business for $250 million
items.summary:
- Google is acquiring a portion of HTC's extended reality (XR) business for $250 million.
- The deal includes transferring some HTC VIVE engineering staff to Google and granting non-exclusive intellectual property rights.
- HTC retains rights to use and develop the technology.
- This is Google's second major deal with HTC, following a $1.1 billion purchase of HTC's smartphone unit in 2017.
- The acquisition aims to enhance the development of the Android XR platform for headsets and glasses.
- The move is part of a competitive landscape in XR technology with rivals like Apple and Meta.
